job_details.visa_sponsorship: All Work Authorizations are Permitted - No Visa Transfers

jd:
Job Description - Title: PEGA Certified LSA
Location: Austin TX (Preferred), Memphis TN, St. Louis MO, or Morris Plains, NJ
Duration: 6 months
Work Eligibility: All Work Authorizations are Permitted - No Visa Transfers
Visa: USC, GC, GC EAD, H4 EAD
LinkedIn is must.
Must have DL LOCAL to one of these cities: Austin TX (Preferred), Memphis TN, St. Louis MO, or Morris Plains, NJ (Hybrid - 3 days/week onsite)
Share resume, work Auth copy and DL
Key Technology: PEGA LSA, PRPC 5.x+, Java
Job Responsibilities:
Design class structures, application frameworks, and data models
Be responsible for building patient Profile Pega Application.
Perform object-oriented analysis and design across a variety of platforms
Troubleshoot application issues, coding bugs, and bottlenecks.
Maintain the security of all system applications.
Coordinate with the project team to ensure the business architecture matches the needs of the customer.
Perform solution architecture within the Pega PRPC environment.
Integrate business databases, legacy systems, and web services.
Skills and Experience Required:
Required:
More than 10 years of relevant experience in Pega development
Advanced knowledge of Pega PRPC 5.x/6.x/7.x.
Familiarity with J2EE, XML, Java, JSP, and EJB.
Familiarity with Scrum and Agile methodology.
Knowledge of coding languages including Angular JS, Java, and JQuery.
Knowledge of web technologies including JavaScript, CSS, HTML5, and XML.
Excellent project management skills.
Ability to troubleshoot complex software issues.
Demonstrated experience in Agile development, application design, software development, and testing
Expertise in object-oriented analysis and design across a variety of platforms
Experience and thorough understanding of Pega RULES Process Commander System or other Business Process Management (BPM) system
Ability to effectively communicate to internal and external business partners on solution
